document_data.name: ''Mac-Fuirmidh Cittern''
document_data.mainbody: A '''''Mac-Fuirmidh cittern''''' ({{Pronounce|mæk|FUR|mid|refs={{Cite dragon/93/Ay pronunseeAYshun gyd|28}}}}) was a masterwork magic [[cittern]] and one of the [[Instruments of the Bards]].
document_data.Description: ''Mac-Fuirmidh citterns'' were pear-shaped citterns similar to [[lute]]s, superior in every way to ordinary citterns. Like other Instruments of the Bards, they could only be used properly by [[bard]]s, and could be dangerous if anyone else attempted to play or even carry them.
document_data.Powers:
Bards wielding a ''Mac-Fuirmidh cittern'' had their charming abilities greatly amplified by their magic.

Like all Instruments of the Bards, these citterns had the capability of storing spells. A bard playing a ''Mac-Fuirmidh cittern'' could invoke the spells ''[[fly]]'', ''[[invisibility]]'', ''[[levitate]]'', ''[[Protection from evil|protection from evil and good]]'', ''[[barkskin]]'', ''[[cure wounds]]'' and ''[[fog cloud]]'' each once a day, until the instrument recharged its magic at the next dawn.
document_data.History:
The first ''Mac-Fuirmidh citterns'' were created by a legendary bard in the [[Moonshae Isles]] named [[Falataer]]. He used them to test and reward the students of the Mac-Fuirmidh level of his bardic college, which came to be regarded individually as a legendary bard college in its own right.

Over time, other bards have copied the original design, while retaining the original name in Falataer's honor.
